abstract.t: When an LSP fails to deliver user traffic, the failure cannot always be detected by the MPLS control plane. RFC 8029 defines a mechanism that would enable users to detect such failure and to isolate faults. YANG, defined in RFC 6020, is a data model definition language that was introduced to define the contents of a conceptual data stores that allow networked devices to be managed using NETCONF, as specified in RFC 6241. This document defines a YANG data model that can be used to configure and manage LSP-Ping.
